intro: Meryta spathipedunculata, commonly known as the New Zealand native tree, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized tree that typically grows in coastal and lowland forests of New Zealand. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Meryta spathipedunculata is well adapted to the humid and temperate climate of its native habitat.
